parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the marker alpha. The marker is modified on all computers in a network session.
<br>
When alpha equals <tt>1</tt>, the marker is visible, but if alpha equals <tt>0</tt>, then the marker is invisible.
<br>
Alpha can be numbers and fractions.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>'''Multiplayer optimisation:''' Global marker commands always broadcast the ''entire'' marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> marker '''setMarkerAlpha''' alpha

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> marker: [[String]] -

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> alpha: [[Number]] -

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> Nothing

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>"my_marker" [[setMarkerAlpha]] 0.5;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>"enemy_convoy_marker" [[setMarkerAlpha]] 0;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setMarkerAlphaLocal]], [[setMarkerBrush]], [[setMarkerColor]], [[setMarkerDir]], [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerShape]], [[setMarkerSize]], [[setMarkerText]], [[setMarkerType]], [[createMarker]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
